metadata.title: CVE-2017-6542 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The ssh_agent_channel_data function in PuTTY before 0.68 allows remoteattackers to have unspecified impact via a large length value in an agentprotocol message and leveraging the ability to connect to the Unix-domainsocket representing the forwarded agent connection, which trigger a bufferoverflow.

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
